newsitem.title: CANADA: WCE canola ends down on good weather prospects.
newsitem.headline: WCE canola ends down on good weather prospects.

text.p: WCE canola futures ended lower on forecasts of slightly warmer than average weather for the next five days and only slight risks of frost to months' end.

"There's more hedges on this forecast for good weekend weather and people don't want to be long ahead of StatsCan's report," a trader said. Sep-Nov spread at $5, Nov-Mar at $7.50. Statistics Canada will issue its first production estimate Monday at 0730 CDT. Volume was light at 1,400 lots.
September canola lost $1.10 to $424.50, November fell $1.80 to $429.60. October flax fell $1.30 to $391, November lost $1 to $363. Volume was light at 33 lots. No oats traded.
October feed wheat lost $2.60 to $203, December lost $2.90 to $188.20. Fusarium in Ontario wheat may limit demand for Prairie feed wheat, a trader said. Volume was 415 lots.
November western barley lost $3.70 to $155.60 on hedge selling which drew commission buying at $158, February fell $3.90 to $161.30 on lower Chicago corn. Volume was 900 lots.
October feed peas rose US$0.50 to US$204, December up US$0.50 to US$206 with LFG buying the Oct-Dec spread from UGG at US$1.50. Volume was 275 lots.
(All values in Canadian dollars/tonne except peas, oats)
